node.title: Vehicle connected to murder at Taupō hotel found by police
node.description: Police have found a vehicle connected to a homicide investigation in Taupō.

node.title: Here are the states suspending their gas taxes
node.description: As gas prices soar across the country to record highs, states are grappling with how to help consumers.

node.title: Watch: What the Covid-19 setting changes mean for rugby
node.description: The prime minister has announced Covid-19 measures will be relaxed but what does that mean for community rugby and Super Rugby Pacific? NZ Rugby head Mark Robinson speals to media.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 11 more deaths, 18,423 new community cases
node.description: Health officials are reporting 11 more people with Covid-19 have died, with 18,423 new community cases reported today.

node.title: Veteran Russian reformer quits job as Putin envoy
node.description: Anatoly Chubais has stepped down from his role as an international envoy for President Vladimir Putin, the most senior official to resign since Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Job confidence rising but inflation leaves households struggling
node.description: Wages are failing to keep pace with inflation, despite a tight job market.

node.title: Former prosecutor says Trump "guilty of numerous felony violations"
node.description: Mark Pomerantz and Carey Dunne were leading the criminal fraud probe of the Trump Organization when they resigned in February.

node.title: Court finds former Samoa PM guilty of contempt
node.description: Leader of the Samoan Human Rights Protection party, Tuilaepa Sailele Malielegaoi, has been found guilty of contempt of court.

node.title: Alcohol pressure group celebrates Auckland Council decision to support MP’s bill
node.description: A group battling against new booze shops in south Auckland is welcoming a council decision to support a bill aimed at tackling alcohol harm.

node.title: Road resurfacing to close section of highway into Nelson
node.description: A section of the main highway into Nelson will be closed next week, as Waka Kotahi crews resurface part of the road.

node.title: Cabinet agrees to 'a landmark change' in engineers' regulation
node.description: Law changes aimed at cracking down on poor engineering are being hailed as a landmark.

node.title: Mark Meadows' wife appears to use invalid address on 2 voter forms
node.description: The wife of former Trump chief of staff Mark Meadows filled out two voter forms that note it's a felony to "fraudulently or falsely" complete it

node.title: Former Boeing test pilot found not guilty of deceiving FAA in 737 Max case
node.description: Prosecutors accused Forkner of misleading Federal Aviation Administration regulators about the amount of training pilots would need to fly the 737 Max.

node.title: Council axing QR codes in light of government changes
node.description: Marlborough District Council intends dropping QR codes at its facilities from this weekend.

node.title: 25-year-old killed after Louisiana tornadoes pick up his truck and house
node.description: Connor Lambert, who used to play football for the local high school, was killed when his home lifted off its stilts and flew over his neighbor's house.

node.title: 'My boss wants me back': People who lost jobs over mandates hope to return
node.description: People who lost their jobs when the vaccine mandates came into force hope to return to work soon.

node.title: British royals' Jamaica visit stirs demands for slavery reparations
node.description: Britain's Prince William and his wife Kate arrived in Jamaica on Tuesday as part of a week-long Caribbean tour, hours after activists protested to demand reparations for slavery amid growing scrutiny…

node.title: 'Lawful and reasonable': Employers can insist on workers being office-based
node.description: Don't expect to continue working from home if your boss wants everyone back in the office, a lawyer says. Audio

node.title: IPCA rules police shooting of Waikato man justified
node.description: The police watchdog says officers who shot and killed a man who fired at them with a military-style rifle were justified in doing so.

node.title: Airlines ask Biden to drop mask mandate and testing requirements for travelers
node.description: The CEOs of 10 U.S.-based airlines signed a letter urging President Biden to drop the requirements, as the U.K., Canada, and the European Union have already done.

node.title: Searching for Gretchen Anthony: The evidence
node.description: Investigators searching for a missing Florida mother soon realized someone was using the COVID-19 pandemic to cover up her disappearance.

node.title: Grant Robertson sets out economic plans ahead of budget
node.description: Finance Minister Grant Robertson has outlined his economic plans ahead of this year's budget, with a key focus on infrastructure, immigration and diversifying the export market.

node.title: Air NZ to bring back staff let go at start of Covid-19 pandemic
node.description: Air New Zealand has brought back 800 furloughed or former staff before the border reopens to tourists. Audio

node.title: Six people injured after shooting in Auckland's Glen Innes
node.description: Six people have been injured - two seriously - when a number of rounds were fired at a property in the Auckland suburb.

node.title: Unseasonably warm temperatures in the West to break records
node.description: Nearly 100 locations are forecast to approach or exceed record high temperatures.

node.title: Child poisoning deaths spiked during the pandemic
node.description: The first nine months of the pandemic saw a 72% jump in serious injuries related to cleaning agents, CPSC finds.

node.title: "Fearless fighter for freedom": World reacts to death of Madeleine Albright
node.description: Current and former politicians from the U.S. and abroad reacted to the news of Albright's death on Wednesday.

node.title: Stimulus checks for gas? Here's what could be coming your way.
node.description: A trio of bills in Congress would offer stimulus payments and rebates to help Americans cope with soaring gas prices.

node.title: Some unvaccinated teachers could remain barred when mandate ends
node.description: The Ministry of Education has told schools they can require Covid-19 vaccination for certain roles even after the government mandate lifts on 5 April. Audio
